1.1.1.title: Is the State party to the following United Nations treaties?

1.1.1a.title: The International Covenant of Economic, Social and Cultural Rights

1.1.1b.title: The Convention on the Rights of the Child

1.1.1c.title: The International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination

1.1.1d.title: The Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities

1.1.1e.title: The International Covention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrants Workser and the Members of Their Families

1.1.1f.title: The Convention relating to the Status of Refugees

1.1.1g.title: The International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

1.1.1h.title: The Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination agains Women

1.1.2.title: Is the State party to the following UNESCO treaty?

1.1.2a.title: The UNESCO Convention against Discrimination in Education

1.1.3.title: Is the State party to the following ILO conventions?

1.1.3b.title: The ILO Worst Forms of Child Labour Convention

1.1.3c.title: The ILO Indigenous and Tribal Peoples Convention

1.1.4.title: Is the State party to the following Geneva conventions?

1.1.4a.title: The Geneva Convention III relative to the Treatment of Prisoners of War

1.1.4b.title: The Geneva Convention IV relative to the Protection of Civilian Persons in Time of War

1.1.4c.title: Protocol I to the Geneva Conventions of 12 August 1949, and relating to the Protection of Victims of International Armed Conflicts

1.1.4d.title: Protocol II to the Geneva Conventions of 12 August 1949, and relating to the Protection of Victims of Non-International Armed Conflicts

1.1.5.title: Is the State party to the following regional treaties?

1.1.5a.title: In Africa: The African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights

1.1.5b.title: In Africa: The Protocal to the African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights on the Rights of Women in Africa

1.1.5c.title: In Africa: The African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child

1.1.5e.title: In Africa: African Union Convention for the Protection and Assistance of Internally Displaced Persons in Africa

1.1.5f.title: In the Americas: The Charter of the Organization of American States

1.1.5g.title: In the Americas: The Additional Protocol to the American Convention on Human Rights, Protocol of San Salvador

1.1.5h.title: In Arab States: The Arab Charter on Human Rights

1.1.5i.title: In Europe: Protocol 1 to the European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms

1.1.5j.title: In Europe: The Revised European Social Charter

1.1.5k.title: In Europe: The European Charter for Regional or Minority Languages

1.1.5l.title: In Europe: The Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities

1.1.5m.title: In Europe: The European Convetnion on the Legal Status of Migrant Workers

1.1.5n.title: In Europe: The Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education in the European Region

1.1.5o.title: In Europe: The European Union Charter of Fundamental Rights

1.2.1.title: Do national laws protect the right to education?

1.2.1a.title: Do national laws protect the right to primary education?

1.2.1b.title: Do national laws protect the right to secondary education?

1.2.1c.title: Do national laws protect the right to technical and vocational education?

1.2.1d.title: Do national laws protect the right to higher education/university?

1.2.2.title: Does the occupying power guarantee all children in their occupied territory the right to education?

1.2.3.title: Do national laws protect the liberty of individuals to establish private schools?

1.2.4.title: Do national laws protect the right of minorities to establish their own schools?

1.2.5.title: Do national laws expressly recognize the liberty of parents to choose the religious and moral education of their children in conformity with their own convictions?

1.3.1a.title: Is there a national education plan that aims to achieve free and compulsory primary education?

1.3.1b.title: Are there targeted imiplmentation dates for each stage of the progressive implmentation of the plan?

1.3.2.title: Does the national education plan include measure to encourage regular attendance at schools and reduce drop-out rates?

1.4.1.title: Are there minimum educational standards applicable to all schools, including private schools?

1.4.2.title: Is there a State body responsible for monitoring the education system?

1.4.3.title: How often is data on education collected nationally and made publicly available?

1.4.4.title: Is education data disaggregated on the following basis?

1.5.1.title: What is the current (2013) public expenditure per pupil as a percentage of the GDP per capita?

1.5.2.title: What was the government expenditure on education as reported as the percentage of GDP allocated to education in 2014?

1.5.3.title: What percentage of the 2014 national education budget came from foreign aid sources (bilateral and multilateral)?

1.5.4.title: What is the percentage of GDP allocated to foreign aid in relation to education? [donor countries]

1.5.5.title: What is the percentage of total national education budget allocated to each level of education?

1.5.6.title: What percentage of he total national education budget is allocated to the following components?

1.5.6b.title: Teaching and learning materials (including teacher training)

1.5.7.title: What percentage of the approved budget for education in the 2013 fiscal year was actually executed?

2.1.1b.title: What is the pupil-classroom ratio for secondary schools in 2014?

2.2.1a.title: What is the percentage of primary schools with toilets in 2014?

2.2.1b.title: What is the percentage of secondary schools with toilets in 2014?

2.2.2a.title: What is the percentage of primary schools with potable water in 2014?

2.2.2b.title: What is the percentage of secondary schools with potable water in 2014?

2.3.1.title: What is the percentage of teachers that are appropriately trained?

2.3.1a.title: What is the percentage of primary school teachers in 2014 that were appropriately trained?

2.3.1b.title: What percentage of secondary school teachers were appropriately trained in 2014?

2.3.2.title: What is the pupil-trained teacher ratio?

2.3.2a.title: What is the pupil-trained teacher ratio for primary schools in 2014?

2.3.2b.title: What is the pupil-trained teacher ratio for secondary schools in 2014?

2.3.3.title: What is the mean teacher slary relative to the national mean salary in 2014?

2.4.1a.title: What is the pupil-textbook ratio for primary schools in 2014?

2.4.1b.title: What is the pupil-textbook ratio for secondary schools in 2014?

3.1.1.title: Do national laws provide free and compulsory primary education?

3.1.2.title: What percent of household spending was spent on primary education in 2013?

3.1.3.title: What percent of household spending was spent on secondary education in 2013?

3.1.4.title: Are tuition fees chared for public university/higher education?

3.1.4a.title: Are tuition fees chared for public university/higher education in 2014?

3.1.4b.title: If yes, what is the average tuition fee for public university/higher education in 2014?

4.1.1.title: Do national laws or policies direct education towards the following aims?

4.1.1a.title: The full development of the child's personality, talents, and mental and physical abilities

4.1.1b.title: The development of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms

4.1.1c.title: The development of respect for the child's parents, cultural identity, language, and values, as well as respect for the values of the child's country and other civilizations

4.1.1d.title: The development of the child's responsiblities in a free society, including understanding, peace, tolerance, equality, and friendship among all persons and groups

4.1.1e.title: The development of respect for the natural environment

4.1.2.title: Does the national curriculum direct education towards the following aims

4.1.2a.title: The full development of the child's personality, talents, and mental and physical abilities

4.1.2b.title: The development of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms

4.1.2c.title: The development of respect for the child's parents, cultural identity, language, and values, as well as respect for the values of the child's country and other civilizations

4.1.2d.title: The development of the child's responsiblities in a free society, including understanding, peace, tolerance, equality, and friendship among all persons and groups

4.1.2e.title: The development of respect for the natural environment

4.1.3.title: Does the required training for teachers include improving the skills necessary for teaching towards the full development of the following aims?

4.1.3a.title: The full development of the child's personality, talents, and mental and physical abilities

4.1.3b.title: The development of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms

4.1.3c.title: The development of respect for the child's parents, cultural identity, language, and values, as well as respect for the values of the child's country and other civilizations

4.1.3d.title: The development of the child's responsiblities in a free society, including understanding, peace, tolerance, equality, and friendship among all persons and groups

4.1.3e.title: The development of respect for the natural environment

5.1.1.title: Do national laws recognize the right to education for children with disabilities?

5.1.2.title: Are reasonable accomodation measures available for children with disabilities in mainstream schools?

5.1.3.title: What is the percentage of teachers trained to teach children with disabilities?

5.2.1.title: Are there mobile schools for children of nomads?

5.2.2.title: Do national laws provide for language of instruction to be in the child's mother tongue?

5.2.3.title: What percent of students are not taught in their mother tongue?

5.3.1.title: Is primary education available in retention center/camps for migrant, refugee, and internally displaced children?

5.3.3.title: Do imprisoned children receive educatin integrated with the general education system (i.e., same curricula)?

5.3.4.title: Are children prisoners-of-war givent he means to pursue their educational activities?

5.4.1a.title: Does national law prohibit early marriage (below the age of 18)?

5.4.1b.title: In 2014, what percent of women were married by the age of 18?
